chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus Dontreal Lathan

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marcus Dontreal Lathan not in court, in custody.  Attorney James Edgar Toran appeared by video for Marcus Dontreal Lathan.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. For reasons stated on the record, defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marcus Dontreal Lathan not in court, in custody.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Marcus Dontreal Lathan.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defendant has a pending matter in another court. Court will accept transfer of another case or authorize transfer for the purpose of a global resolution. Defense counsel requests a scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant not in court, in custody at HOC. Attorney James Edgar Toran appeared by video for Marcus Dontreal Lathan.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court in person for State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Morales-Colon. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 11.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marcus Dontreal Lathan not in court, defendant in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Toran was present prior to the case being called on the record. Due to court congestion and the lateness of the hour Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered an oral no unsupervised contact order with MDL

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Marcus Dontreal Lathan in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Marcus Dontreal Lathan in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marcus Dontreal Lathan appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
